qas.question: To what number did the size of the orchestra grow to?
What size of choirs have performed Gustav Mahler's 1906 Symphony No. 8?
What size orchestras have performed Gustav Mahler's 1906 Symphony No. 8?
What allowed Brass instruments to play a wider range of notes?
What array of instrument grew wider?

context: The family of instruments used, especially in orchestras, grew. A wider array of <a4_0>percussion<a4_0/> instruments began to appear. Brass instruments took on larger roles, as the introduction of <a3_0>rotary valves<a3_0/> made it possible for them to play a wider range of notes. The size of the orchestra (typically around 40 in the Classical era) grew to be over <a0_0>100<a0_0/>. Gustav Mahler's 1906 Symphony No. 8, for example, has been performed with <a2_0>over 150<a2_0/> instrumentalists and choirs of <a1_0>over 400<a1_0/>.
